Finally, all players reveal their opinions, and everyone who guessed correctly scores a point.

223126.name: Druid Spells (PRD)
223126.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

223127.name: Druid Spells (3PP)
223127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

223128.name: The Watch
223128.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Watch is Powered by the Apocalypse. These quick to learn and intuitive rules are designed to get everyone at the table straight into the game as soon as possible. Character creation is quick, cooperative, and fun, and you can run the game from start to finish with little-to-no prep. We've seen brand new and veteran tabletop gamers try out this system and in every case they've taken to it right away. The Watch can be taught to newcomers in just a few minutes but the rules are robust enough to scratch that mechanical itch that so many of us enjoy.

223129.name: The Pip System Corebook
rpgpodcastepisode: 51 – Pip System: Nigel Steele Saves the World
223129.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Pip System is what Third Eye Games has used in the past for a number of family-style RPGs, including Mermaid Adventures and Infestation, An RPG of Bugs and Heroes. Each of those games and their mechanical iterations have been nominated for Best Family Game at the ENnie Awards. We've taken what lessons these first editions had to teach to further develop and expand upon the game and its systems. Our goal is a complete toolbox of mechanics for almost any gaming experience. The Pip System Corebook has all you need to create characters in a Modern, Fantasy, Sci-Fi or Spooky! setting, each with their own gear and equipment, character backgrounds, and tone, but all the while using the same core set of mechanics to make the game happen.

223130.name: The Pip System Adventure Collection
rpgpodcastepisode: 51 – Pip System: Nigel Steele Saves the World
223130.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

A collection of four adventures for the Pip System [that] model the genres presented in the corebook: Modern, Spooky!, Fantasy, and Sci-Fi.

223132.name: Underleague
223132.description:
Underleague is a fantasy card game set in the smoke-filled city of Helgarten. Players take on the role of breeders assembling a stable of fantastical creatures and mechanical monstrosities, and entering them into illegal pit fights against each other - while also betting on the outcome of these bouts.

In Underleague, each player has a 30 card creature deck. During the game, 3 of these cards will be in play as that player's current stable. Each creature has a unique effect, and a value which contributes to a player's over-all victory points. Each round, players use these creatures to challenge their opponents', while betting on which creatures will win and lose fights. Winning fights results in additional victory points.

There is an additional shared 250 card strategy deck, from which players will draw scheme cards and equipment cards, which can be used to impact the results of fights and the flow of the game. The more correct bets a player makes during a round, the more strategy cards they will be able to draw in the next. The first player to achieve a total of 20 victory points wins the game.

Underleague contains a total of 30 unique creature cards and 40 unique strategy cards. In addition to the basic game mode, it also contains rules for 'constructed' and 'draft' play.

223133.name: BAHOOCHIE!
223133.description:
An eejits card game.

If you have played Top Trumps, then you'll know how to play BAHOOCHIE! It's a very similar game with a Scottish theme where players battle with eejits to try and win them all! But the game comes with a wee twist.....

The BAHOOCHIE! cards can change everything! How you win or lose a single round or even how you win or lose the entire game.

Players battle curious creatures to try and win them all. Usually the highest score on the card wins, but shout BAHOOCHIE! and you can change how the game is played, how a round is won. Watch out, though - BAHOOCHIE! cards can be a help or a hindrance - it's the chance you take.

All cards feature unique art & curious eejits. There are 29 CREATURE CARDS and 16 special BAHOOCHIE CARDS – Deep Fried Battered Food Product (of some description), Bagpipes of Dooooooom!, Sporrans and other weird Scottish stuff are included in each pack!

223134.name: New Frontier Days: Founding Pioneers
223134.description:
"New Frontier Days ~Founding Pioneers~" is a town-building simulation game, where you command your pioneers to colonize a new land.

The pioneers are capable of "Logging", "Mining", "Hunting", "Fishing" and many others. Command them accordingly, and build your own town efficiently!

From the materials gathered via the actions of your pioneers,
you can then use them to "Build"!
With the buildings, you can then process logs into lumber, weave wool into textiles, grow plants with the Field and many more!
Make your town thrive with all these useful buildings!

You can also keep wild animals as pets too!
Pets can go out with the pioneers to gather materials, or they can help in hunting, and even allow pioneers to ride on their backs!

Source: The Game Website.

223135.name: Ik Vertrek
223135.description:
Do you have success abroad?
Are you curious whether a foreign adventure can wager success?
In this family game the goal is to move abroad and start a new life.
Survive obstacles, learn a new language, adjust to a different culture.
The players move on a path via a roll & move mechanic and have to handle events and do tasks depending on which spot they land.
The player who reaches the finish first is the winner.

223136.description:
This is a set of non-addon items for Masmorra that were only available during the Kickstarter campaign.

Among the exclusives there were fourteen new heroes, all have cards which allow the heroes to be used in Arcadia Quest and Arcadia Quest Inferno:
Quan
Baruk
Thereon
Lotus
Tosh
Azure
Blossom
Toghor
Travis
Raffi
Grenouille
Makumba
Hyldir
Zsa Zsa

Among the exclusives there were 10 new monsters among 5 types:
2 Undead Dice
2 Villain Dice
2 Infernal Dice
2 Nameless Dice
2 Rigor Mortis Dice (This kickstarter exclusive box is the only way to get these monster dice. They are not available in the Promo Dice Set)

In addition to the monsters dice and heroes, there was one kickstarter exclusive upgraded component:

5 Treasure Chests
223136.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia - Kickstarter Exclusives

223137.name: WordChance
223137.description:
Description from the publisher:

In WordChance, players can easily make large words using the 16 tiles in their hand. The score for the word is based on the product of the number of letters in the word played and the value on a multiplier chance card selected during the player turn. The multiplier cards have values of 0 to 10, -5 and -10. Hence playing a large word may be a good thing, or a bad thing.

The game board has 676 spaces for word forming (26x26 spaces).

There are also other types of chance cards:


Bonus word cards that allows the player to play a second word during their turn.
A swap tiles card which causes the players to switch their game tiles with that of the player to their left.
A bankrupt card which sets the total score of the player to zero. If chosen early in the game, the player can recover. This card is only put in the card deck if there are three or more players.


We think that the ability to make larger words and the addition of chance makes WordChance lots fun to play.

223138.name: Heads or Tales
223138.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to roleplay in a fantastical world, deep in space, or maybe the untamed wild west? Heads or Tales allows you and your friends to roleplay in any setting you’d like; the only limit is your imagination! The rules are simple: tell a story with a group of friends, and leave your fate to the flip of a coin.

Heads or Tales is for groups with any level of experience with roleplaying games. Since all you need is a coin, you can take the story with you on the go. Grab a coin and some friends, and start telling your story today!

223139.name: Heads or Tales Supplement Bundle 1
223139.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The simplicity of Heads or Tales allows your group to tell stories of any kind, with your imagination being the only limit. Sometimes though, we need a little creative inspiration. That’s what the Heads or Tales Supplement Bundle 1 is for! In it, you will find guides for running sessions in fantasy, science fiction, and wild west settings. These guides provide scenario generators for the GM in order to quickly get the opening threads of the story put together, so your group can get into the action even faster. On top of that, they provide helpful world-building questions for the group to discuss to really get a feel for the themes of your story. This is the first of our supplement bundles, so keep an eye out for future supplements with even more genres!

223140.name: The Meat Lover's Guide to the Post Apocalypse
223140.description:
From the introduction:

In many role playing game genres, acquiring enough food to live on is often a trivial manner. In a modern setting, you usually just take some of your cash and head out to the local store or fast food joint. If you are playing a science fiction campaign, there's often a shipboard nutrition center that can squirt out some vitamin loaded, synthesized junk for you. If your genre is choice is cyberpunk, you are probably eat less and less these days since you replaced most of your organic body with plastic and steel components. Even in fantasy worlds there are often plenty of solutions for hunger. If you get a craving in your gut and you simply head to the nearest tavern. If that fails then someone else in the party often has a spell or a magic ring to solve your problem.

The post apocalypse settings often do not have such quick and easy options.

223141.name: Quickplay RPG
223141.description:
From the introduction:

Quickplay RPG is a rules-lite, universal roleplaying system with just a little bit of optional crunch to the rules to add some diversity, strategy, and challenge. All you need are some six-sided dice, paper, writing tools, and two or more players.

223142.name: KLAsh for Freedom
223142.description:
From publisher blurb:

You play as a mentally and physically gifted individual who has been recruited by the KLA (Kyrilian Liberation Army). You have been sought out by the leaders of the KLA to be trained as an ESP (Elite Special Purpose) trooper. These ESP troops are highly trained special forces soldiers that are the KLA's best weapon against their oppressors, the Malytians. By increasing their skills and accomplishing increasingly dangerous missions, you move toward your ultimate goal: freeing the planet from the deathly grip of Malytian rule.

223143.name: Mr Moustache Jump N' Run
223143.description:
User Summary

Help our hirsute hero escape from the wall of spikes that is relentlessly hounding him! Collect the gems and upgrade his mustachial prowess.

223144.description:
Phobos Infection tries to understand what happened in 1959 when the spacecraft X27 was lost during its voyage to the far flung moon of Mars, Phobos. During this trick taking game, you will fight the four viruses of The Red Planet's moon by various means of attempting to not win tricks, trumps, or even certain high value cards.

After each round an infection occurs and the most infected players will spread their viruses. No one is immune. The least infected player at the end of the game (either 9 rounds with 3 players, or 8 rounds with 4 players) will live to tell the story of the lost X27.
223144.name: Phobos Infection: The Lost Journey of X27

223146.name: Earache: Extreme Metal Racing
223146.description:
Earache: Extreme Metal Racing is a budget title from UK developer Data Design Interactive and Metro 3D. It incorporates an Extreme metal music soundtrack from artists signed on the Earache Records record label as players race. It has been released on the PC and PlayStation 2. The PC version of the game was packaged in an Earache Compilation set called Worldwide Metal.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earache%3A_Extreme_Metal_Racing Earache: Extreme Metal Racing]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

223147.name: Tales from the Loop
223147.description:
From the publisher:

In 1954, the Swedish government ordered the construction of the world’s largest particle accelerator. The facility was complete in 1969, located deep below the pastoral countryside of Mälaröarna. The local population called this marvel of technology The Loop.

Acclaimed scifi artist Simon Stålenhag’s paintings of Swedish 1980s suburbia, populated by fantastic machines and strange beasts, have spread like wildfire on the Internet. Stålenhag’s portrayal of a childhood against a backdrop of old Volvo cars and coveralls, combined with strange and mystical machines, creates a unique atmosphere that is both instantly recognizable and utterly alien.

Now, for the first time, you will get the chance to step into the amazing world of the Loop.

In this game, you play teenagers in the late Eighties, solving Mysteries connected to the Loop. Choose between character Types such as the Bookworm, the Troublemaker, the Popular Kid and the Weirdo. Everyday Life is full of nagging parents, never-ending homework and classmates bullying and being bullied.

The Mysteries let the characters encounter the strange machines and weird creatures that have come to haunt the countryside after the Loop was built. The kids get to escape their everyday problems and be part of something meaningful and magical – but also dangerous.

223148.name: Hut ab
223148.description:
This game can be played in 4 different ways.

1.The players have to get their 2 figures to the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. If a figure reaches or overtakes an opponent figure, this figure loses it's hat and can't move until the player rolls a 6. At the marked spaces the figures of the same color advance to an inner circle. The colored spaces between circles are safe spaces. The figures may stop there, even if they rolled more than is required to reach that space.

2. The players have to build their figures by rolling a die for the parts they need to assemble their figures.

3. This is a combination of game 1 and 2. The players have to assemble their figures before they may enter the boardgame.

4. The game is played as a pachisi variant with 2 meeples per player.

223149.name: Village of Horror
223149.description:
The quiet village is no longer peaceful. Under the influence of a blood moon that appears once every hundred years, werewolves hiding amongst the villagers feel their blood flow and thirst for action. The cunning and sly werewolves do not easily reveal their hiding place, so how can the naive villagers survive? Will they opt for self-preservation — or stand up against the werewolves? As the night passes, players' survival instincts and quickness of mind are tested, and the treacherous and fickle villagers are the most unpredictable terror of this dark and eery night.

Village of Horror is a werewolf-themed card game in which players choose factions in the game and help their respective factions win by playing different cards. Only the winner will live to see the sun rise!

223150.name: Spacetours VR - Ep1 The Solar System
223150.description:
Discover space like never before in this aesthetic and inspiring experience. Travel to the eight planets of the Solar System. Features stunning visuals, bold sound effects, support of motion-controllers and level streaming with no loading screens for total immersion.

Source: The Game Website.

223151.description:
Entropy: Worlds Collide is a competitive card game of risk, deception and action management for 2 to 5 players.

The game is a remake of its predecessor, Entropy.

Multiple parallel worlds have collided and you play as one of six characters jettisoned from their world into a place called the Nexus. Each character's world has been shattered into four separate shards that when pieced together forms a complete panoramic vista of their world.

Through the use of unique character abilities and special actions, players must find shards of their reality and be the first to piece them back together in order to save their world and return home.

Each turn, players select a single action from the six they have available, keeping it hidden from their opponents. All players then reveal their chosen action at the same time.

Playing the best action at the right time won't be easy. Should two or more players select the same action, a "Clash" occurs and none of those players will be able to perform their action.

Take risks, deceive and outwit your opponents to save your world, and earn your right to return home.
223151.name: Entropy: Worlds Collide

223152.name: Ring Magic
223152.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Since the dawn of the world, dwarven smiths have fashioned rings of surpassing beauty—but it is not for the sake of beauty alone that these rings are made. There is power in them, which can be unlocked by the wise. Ring magic practitioners channel their magic through these rune-etched metal bands, increasing the devastation wreaked upon their foes; and can even imbue them with spells that someone else can unleash later.

Deep Magic: Ring Magic brings the secrets of ring magic into your 5e campaign, featuring:
- New ring magic feats, and a new Ring Warden arcane tradition
- 12 new spells, including enchant ring, curse ring, and create ring servant (with monster stats for this new construct), and more!
- New magic items: molten fire forge, oathbound ring, warden’s link, and Karrek’s Bastion
- The history of ring magic, the dwarves who are its masters, and the secrets of their legendary stronghold

Journey deep within the earth, to places where molten rock flows like rivers, and the sounds of hammers never cease. Here you will find the true power of the rings—learn their ways, and use them wisely and well.

223153.name: Die Young
223153.description:
Kidnapped for no clear reason to a dazzling yet mysterious island on the Mediterranean Sea, a young girl has to find a way to escape. Armed with only her wits, agility, and the will to survive, she must make her getaway or Die Young.

Source: The Game Website.

223154.name: Freeman: Star Edge
223154.description:
User Summary

EXPLORE VAST UNIVERSE

Have you ever dreamed yourself flying across the galaxy and land on different planets? How about walking on the street of futuristic cities, or sneaking into ruins of lost civilization buried under the surface of a frozen world. A vivid sci-fi open world waiting for you to discover! Cities, settlements, caves, snow lands, ocean worlds, deserts and space stations...

223155.name: Resistance!
223155.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Makarondo is located to the North of Cordelliana, where six other similar villages are found. Unlike them, however, Makarondo is surrounded by impenetrable jungle feared by its inhabitants – dangerous animals do live there and dangerous tropical diseases can afflict those who enter.

223156.name: Dark and Light
223156.description:
Dark and Light is a vast sandbox RPG set in a world dominated by powerful elemental forces. Find your way in a meticulously crafted world, featuring breathtaking landscapes, a wide variety of mythical creatures, and limitless possibility to craft, build, and unlock over 100 abilities.

Source: The Game Website.

223157.name: The Aeronauts of Ismond
223157.description:
From the introduction:

The inhabitants of Ismond, an isolated island in the Plane of Air, are facing extinction as their island plummets towards The Great Conflagration. In a desperate effort to save his people, Silas Scorch, the Islands most powerful sorcerer, calls forth for help to save the thousands of souls that call Ismond home.

223161.name: Doubutsu Rensa (どうぶつれんさ)
223161.description:
User summary
どうぶつれんさ (Doubutsu Rensa) in English means 'Animal Linker Card' and is in the position between being a card game and being a board game. While simple rules make it playable for children from the age of four, the game also has strategic aspects that make it just as enjoyable for adults.

Before beginning the game, place cards face-down in rows to create the board. Arrange each row to start and end at the halfway point of the starting and ending cards of the rows above and below in a double pyramid pattern.There should be a total of 7 rows, but players are free to arrange these rows into any shape they please (doesn't have to be a straight line).

Deal four cards to each player to form their hand. The player who doesn’t go first is dealt one additional card. The remaining cards serve as the deck.

The players may then proceed to freely exchange the cards in their hand with cards from the row on the board closest to them to form their own “base”. After the cards making up the base have been chosen, these cards should be placed face up.

During a player’s own turn, they may play a card from their hand that connects with the characters drawn upon one of the cards previously played faced up on the table.

If a face-down card is available where the player places their card, this card is taken into the player’s hand. If a face up card is already placed where a player wishes to play their card, the player simply places their card on top of this card.

A player may chose to either place a card or pass and draw a card from the deck. The first player to place a card on top of their opponent’s base is the winner.

Publisher's summary
「どうぶつれんさ」は4歳から遊べるシンプルなルールながら、大人も楽しめる戦略性もあるカードゲームとボードゲームの中間のようなゲームです。

ゲーム開始前にカードを裏向きに並べてボードを作ります。
列ごとに半分ずつずらすように並べ、おおむね7列で線対象の形であれば自由な形が可能です。

プレイヤーに手札を4枚ずつ配り、後攻になったプレイヤーに1枚手札を多く与えます。残りを山札とします。
次にプレイヤーは自分に一番近いボードの列のカードと、手札を自由に入れ替えて「ベース」を作ります。「ベース」を決めたら表向きにします。

プレイヤーは自分のターンに、手札のカードと既にボードにある表向きのカードに描かれたキャラクターが繋がるようにカードを出します。
　そこに裏向きのカードがあれば、裏向きのカードは手札に加え、表向きのカードがあれば、そのまま上に重ねます。

カードを1枚出すか、出さずにパスをして山札から1枚ドローしたら相手にターンを回します。

先に相手の「ベース」の上にカードを置いた方の勝ちとなります。

223162.description:
Publisher's summary
Safari-Dual is a kind of Chess game, using three kinds of pieces; Lion, Elephant and Giraffe. The board and pieces are made of ceramic.

The Lion is the King and the Elephants and Giraffes are the Pawns. The winner is the first to capture the opponent's Lion, or to move their own Lion onto the opponent’s Lion's base area.

Pieces have dual natures; one is their shape and the other is their species.

Players move their own pieces and try to sandwich any of the opponent's piece or pieces. If the player's pieces making the sandwich are of the same species, this is a capture and the captured animals are removed from the board. A Lion can sandwich and capture any opponent’s pieces, using their own Elephant or Giraffe piece as the other end of the sandwich.

But the dual nature of the pieces gives the game more complexity.

For example, a player's own Elephant piece will sandwich and capture the opponent's Giraffes and Lion by using the opponent's Elephant. The same specie will work together! Likewise, the opposing Giraffes will work together to capture the opponent's Elephants and Lion. Only the two Lions will not work together.

This dual system is a unique and very interesting system first invented by the designer Mitsuo Yamamoto in 2008, and the game was first produced in 2011, a small and a large edition. A new edition is being produced in 2017 for a Kickstarter campaign.
boardgameversion: Japanese second edition - Safari-Dual Small - Kickstarter edition
223162.name: Safari-Dual

223163.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 80 - Mar/Apr 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Character Detailing Rules: Certification for Player-Characters
Confessions of a Newbie Referee: #27: Still a Newbie
Getting Off the Ground: Instant Murder Mystery for In the Grey
In the Grey: Starship Activities In Jumpspace
Instant Murder Mystery for the Grey
Lecture Hall and Library: Jump Destination: Nutema
Mongoose Traveller 2nd Ed. The Pirates of Drinax: The Torpol Cluster
The Club Room: The Wayward: A Terraforming Company
223163.description:
From the contents page:

Freelance Traveller #080: March/April 2017

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.

223164.name: Nine-Tenths of the Law
223164.description:
From publisher blurb:

A job conducting a wilderness survey lands the team smack in the middle of a smuggling scheme and a war between primitive tribes for possession of a lost cargo. Can they navigate a shifting scene of lies and warfare to determine what's really going on?

Nine-Tenths of the Law is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

223165.name: Common Places #22
223165.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure located in fantasy urban environment. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

Common places #022 consists of maps and handouts of The Toll Tower- wher River guard Collect money for the government.

The set consists of:

Royal quater map (district map);
topdown view
ground floor plan;
1st floor plan;
a perspective drawing of The Toll Tower.

223166.name: Clone Wars Adventures Trading Card Game
223166.description: The Clone Wars Adventures Trading Card Game is a trading card game based on the mini-game Card Commander from Clone Wars Adventures MMO. Duel your opponent with cards featuring characters, ships and vehicles from Star Wars: The Clone Wars! When you win a duel, attack one of your opponent's hidden bases. Reveal the base's defense and destroy it! When you destroy your opponent's last base, you win!

223167.name: Secret Unknown Stuff: Escape from Dulce
223167.description:
Description from the publisher:

Everyone has heard of Area 51 and the Roswell incident, but very few have heard of Dulce Base. Many believe it to be a joint military/alien underground facility where horrible experiments are being conducted on abducted humans and various life forms held captive there. In the base’s subterranean depths is where you are being held prisoner. Welcome to the bizarre and top secret world of ‘Escape from Dulce,' Sentient Cow Games first installment in our themed anthology board game series called “Secret Unknown Stuff, where players are taken through science fiction adventures, supernatural stories and unexplained events.

Escape from Dulce is a collaborative, turn-based, sci-fi adventure game for 2 to 6 players, ages 14 and up. Players choose from 8 hilariously bizarre prisoners, including a two-headed mutant cow that can strap machine guns on its back, to a alien hybrid super solider who dreams of being a normal teenager and hanging out at the ‘mall.’ Each player starts with special skills and different abilities, which they can increase as they escape.

Escape from Dulce will be different each time it's played, because of how the player decides to customize their character, interact with the encounter cards, and how our 'artificial intelligence' combat system dictates how the enemies will focus their attacks. Story based encounter cards add an organic 'role-play' feel to game play, forcing the players to adapt to an ever-changing base full of traps and self-strategizing human and non-human enemies. The game thinks. It's alive. And it’s trying to kill you.

Players must find hidden objectives to gain entry to the next level, while constantly working to keep the alarm from reaching critical and releasing the dreaded 'Man in Black.' The alarm building aspect creates a sense of urgency and drive to the game. Players can also enlist the help of strange 'hidden characters' along the way, as they progress up seven dangerous levels of a 3D game board to freedom.

223170.name: Glorpy!
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
223170.description:
(publisher blurb)

Glopry! A shlorpingly vlarted digi-zine of fluborted OSR oddities and other nice things.

This is a collection of OSR roleplaying materials created by a strange brew of gamers for your entertainment. Compatible with most old school games such as Swords & Wizardry, OSRIC, Labyrinth Lord, and even some DCC RPG thrown in to boot.

223171.name: Catan: Seafarers Scenario – Legend of the Sea Robbers
223171.description:
Catan: Seafarers Scenario – Legend of the Sea Robbers includes four new linked scenarios that tell the "Legend of the Sea Robber" to celebrate the 20th anniversary of Catan: Seafarers. Each scenario can be played individually, with players trying to win the game as usual by collecting ten victory points, but players can also record their scores at the end of each scenario, with effects of one game affecting the next.

Catan: Seafarers Scenario – Legend of the Sea Robbers requires both the Catan base game and the Catan: Seafarers expansion.

223173.name: Peng Lai: Mythic Chinese Adventuring
223173.description:
A Cinematic Story Game of High Epic Fantasy

From the introduction:

There is a story in Peng Lai that is passed down through the years that speaks about those born into this world with the favor of heaven written upon them. These chosen few will bring about a great change into the world; for better or for worse. It is written that you will know them by the symbols that denote their status and that they will appear a score of years after the stars that mark them have aligned. This alignment happens once in a 1000 years, and it has been 20 years since the last great celestial alignment. All of Peng Lai now waits with abated [sic] breath for what is to happen next.

223174.name: Pocket Things
223174.description:
A Game for People with Pockets

From the introduction:

Take a Thing out of your pocket. If you don't have a Thing, take something out of someone else's pocket. Put the Thing in a Place. Now everybody will pretend you didn’t just do that.

223175.name: Stargazing
223175.description:
An easy to learn universal roleplaying system for children!

From the introduction:

Stargazing is a roleplaying game for children, it is about imagination and creating. The Core rule is that anything can be done as long as it's plausible in the game setting. The game mechanics are simple, using 2D6 (2 six sided dice), anytime the players try something that sounds like it should be rolled on, set a "Target number" or "reachable" modifier and have them roll.

223176.name: Timeless
223176.description:
From the introduction:

Timeless the RPG is a pencil and paper role playing game system that is setting agnostic. The basic game is made to work with any setting by providing a quick way to resolve conflicts, and open ended character creation and development.

User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by Attributes and Skills. Action resolution utilizes a modified 2d6 roll against a target difficulty.

223178.name: Franchise Hockey Manager 2
223178.description:
Franchise Hockey Manager 2 (FHM 2) is a text-based ice hockey simulation for career, historical, and fictional play.

FHM 2 allows the user to take control of a team in any of 21 leagues from around the world, including the NHL, KHL, Canadian leagues, minor leagues in the US, leagues in the UK, leagues in Sweden and Finland, and more. You can also play any historical NHL or WHA season back to 1931 or create a custom fictional setup. FHM 2 also contains a new game engine, a revamped tactics system and support for league expansion.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franchise_Hockey_Manager Franchise Hockey Manager]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

223179.name: Franchise Hockey Manager 2014
223179.description:
Franchise Hockey Manager, abbreviated as FHM, is a text-based ice hockey simulation for career, historical, and fictional play.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franchise_Hockey_Manager Franchise Hockey Manager]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

223180.name: Franchise Hockey Manager 1
223180.description:
Franchise Hockey Manager, abbreviated as FHM, is a text-based ice hockey simulation for career, historical, and fictional play.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franchise_Hockey_Manager Franchise Hockey Manager]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

223181.name: Franchise Hockey Manager 3
223181.description:
Franchise Hockey Manager 3 is the deepest, most authentic hockey strategy experience you can find, including:

For the first time ever, officially licensed by the NHL®
An all new mode – Path to Glory – to get you in and having fun faster
Take the reins of your favorite NHL® franchise to capture the Stanley Cup® Championship
Tons of new features, options, and tactics
And so much more!

Source: The Developer Website.

223183.name: Quiz o Europie: mini
223183.description:
Description from the publisher (translated):
"Quiz about Europe - mini" - fascinating game and great fun, during which participants answer questions about Europe. Players can answer 180 questions with 45 cards, and they have 540 answers to choose from. Topics for questions and answers are: history, geography and nature, science and technology and the art and culture of Europe. "Quiz about Europe - mini" is an exciting and exciting entertainment for the whole family, and its participants can expand their knowledge of Europe while playing.

Description from the publisher:
"Quiz o Europie - mini" - fascynująca gra i świetna zabawa, w trakcie której uczestnicy odpowiadają na pytania o Europie. Gracze mogą odpowiadać na 180 pytań z 45 kart, a do wyboru mają 540 odpowiedzi. Tematami pytań i odpowiedzi są: historia, geografia i przyroda, nauka i technika oraz kultura i sztuka Europy. "Quiz o Europie - mini" to atrakcyjna i emocjonująca rozrywka dla całej rodziny, a jej uczestnicy mogą w czasie zabawy poszerzyć swoją wiedzę o Europie.

223184.name: Village Attacks: Greed & Fury
223184.description: The Greed & Fury add on introduces 2 new monsters, the Draugr and Red Cap, as well as the Shield Maiden and Celt Town Heroes.

223185.name: Village Attacks: Terror & Anguish
223185.description: This pack introduces some of the most notorious monsters of all time to the castle; the Werewolf and Sandman!

223186.name: Village Attacks: Wrath & Ruin
223186.description:
This add on introduces 2 new Monsters and 2 new Heroes:
-Leshy
-Glaistig
-Pathfinder
-Jailer

223188.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 92 - Jan 2017)
223188.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

Songs of the North
House Swords
Nobles of the North

223189.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 93 - Feb 2017)
223189.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

223190.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 94 - Mar 2017)
223190.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Imarth
The Port of Gimmloth

223191.name: Mont-à-mots Agent Secret
223191.description:
Your mission: to identify the secret agent and discover the country where he is hiding.

Roll the dice, formulate mathematical equations and get information about the secret agent you're looking for. Filter the information and decode the name of the country where it is hiding.

Secret Agent, from the Mont-à-mots family, promotes learning and developing mental math skills with this suspenseful game where your deduction spirit is strongly sought.

Essentially, each turn, the player rolls 4 dice. If he can formulate a mathematical equation (+ - × ÷) with at least 2 dice to equal one of the numbers on the board, he can look at the related hint. The hint can be the and encoded version name of the country (which can be decoded using a wheel), a clue about the appearance of the person to find or if there is a traitor among the informants. A player win as soon as he guess who among the suspects is the wanted person as well as the country where he is hiding.

223192.name: Chamice
223192.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chamice is a lost world to be found out on the Fringe. Inside you will find all the details of the fantastic creatures and dangers that wait explorers of this strange new world.

As a special bonus with this new series of IF Treats, this new series of creatures of the Infinite Creatures series come with their own unique Fringe world (thus allowing for a wider range of environments than are currently cataloged in the populated worlds of the Fringe.) Of course, this in no way means that these creatures must be used with this new world, nor that they even must be used in the Fringe setting. This new Origin World is, instead, intended to be a way of introducing strange and otherworldly sci fi creatures into a campaign within their own unique world with as little need for work from the Gamemaster to make that happen. These oddities come with a world ready made to receive them, a world which can be plopped down ready made into any Infinite Futures campaign.

223193.name: The Shapeshifter
223193.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Best Toolbox Class You Never Knew You Wanted To Play

Introducing the Shapeshifter! This 37 page beast of a book features the easy-to-use base class features 9 mantles and over 80 "visages" (ways to morph their body). With so many ways to play- you'll never play the same shapeshifter twice! Check out this full BAB, d10 HD, 4 + Int skill ranks per level, character in our extensive PDF preview!

Included:

The Shapeshifter Base Class!
3 Shape Shifting Archetypes! The "wild dog" barbarian, "wild thing" druid, and "Charadier" for rogue!
8 New Feats!
8 New Magic Items!

223194.name: Fire in the Mountain
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
223194.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Door has been Opened, and the Fire Released! A New DCC Funnel!

Urisk are a curious race, cousins to the fey but preferring to gambol through the high mountain passes, barely interested in the life and squabbles of empires and gods… which does not protect them from the struggles of dark forces! Billy the urisk found Something Left Behind in the conflict between demon-gods and Elemental Lords, and it threatens to wreak fiery destruction on the lonely mountains above Morton’s Pass.

As a young and frisky urisk, and unafraid of fire, will you brave the dark passages of the fallen Temple of Krakaal and put things right, saving your people? Daniel Bishop’s AL 8: Fire in the Mountain from Purple Duck Games is a level-0 funnel for the exciting Dungeon Crawl Classics role-playing game, easily scalable for higher level adventure.

Here’s what you get when you get hold of Fire in the Mountain; the backstory of the Temple of Krakaal, connecting the adventure to AL 6: Playing the Game, and AL 7: The Elemental Lords Awaken! both by Purple Duck Games, a 0-level funnel adventure in the depths of the corrupted Temple- that can easily be scaled for higher-level adventure, and provides for taking the players to any location you wish… and a full-length section of playing the new DCC- compatible race of the Urisk, capricious fey goat-men of the high mountain passes! Great value for superior material, get your copy of Fire in the Mountain from the gregarious goat-men at Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

223195.name: The Vanishing Ensign
223195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ticket of Leave #4 is a double-size supplement which borrows from the historical incident of Bligh's Grand Muster to create a detailed campaign frame which 'Convicts & Cthulhu' Keepers can use to send their players' investigators to some of the most far-flung and frightening parts of the colony. Charged with collecting the Governor's information they must travel from place to place, passing through dangerous and poorly-explored territories. The Ticket of Leave also includes a detailed scenario outline which can be used to kick off a grand campaign -- complete with three choices of ending, each of them poisoned (but in different ways) by the corrupt forces of the Cthulhu Mythos.

223196.name: Woodridge (5E)
223196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruled over for centuries by the scheming, ambitious Lorsch family, Woodridge is little more than a backwater village standing on the eastern bounds of the Duchy of Ashlar. Standing astride an ancient, now little-used trade route the village is a poor, but seemingly peaceful place. Its folk tend their small fields, pay their lord his due and are content to be left in peace. But all is not as it seems. Spies lurk among the populace, and dark forces gather which would see Woodridge’s lord, Hilduin Lorsch, converted to their faith or dead.

223197.name: Woodridge (System Neutral Edition)
223197.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruled over for centuries by the scheming, ambitious Lorsch family, Woodridge is little more than a backwater village standing on the eastern bounds of the Duchy of Ashlar. Standing astride an ancient, now little-used trade route the village is a poor, but seemingly peaceful place. Its folk tend their small fields, pay their lord his due and are content to be left in peace. But all is not as it seems. Spies lurk among the populace, and dark forces gather which would see Woodridge’s lord, Hilduin Lorsch, converted to their faith or dead.

223198.name: The Vanguard, A New Hybrid Class
223198.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #111 introduces the vanguard, a hybrid class of the ranger and rogue that focuses on skills of espionage and survival. The vanguard excels in quick and deadly strikes then disappearing back into her surroundings.

223199.name: Slab (M&M3)
223199.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bullies are all around us and come from all walks of life. It's tough enough to stand up to one when they are bigger and stronger, but what happens when they have super powers? Due to his abilities, Slab is a law enforecement nightmare. Do your heroes have what it takes to put him down?

223201.name: Jelly Squad
223201.description:
A jelly monster has invaded the city! Now you and the other members of the "Jelly Squad" must compete to scoop that jelly from the streets. Who will do the most to save their fellow citizens?

In Jelly Squad, your forces are represented by dice, and in each of the four rounds, you'll place these dice in the seven districts of the city to try to grab jelly. All players play simultaneously. At the start of the round, all players roll their dice into their reserve, choose one die to place on a district, reroll all their remaining dice, place one die, etc. until all of their dice have been placed. When you place a 3 or 4, you can move the slider in that district to affect what the reward will be for whoever has the largest sum in that district. When you place a 1 or 2, you can remove another die from that district and place it in the center of the board. When you place a 5 or 6, you can feel satisfied that you have a high number — assuming it stays put.

Once the round ends, you see who holds the majority in each district and hand out rewards. Whoever has the most jelly after four rounds wins!

223202.name: Saints & Sinners
223202.description:
From the introduction:

The 20th century was marked by the largest wars in human history. World War I and World War II spanned the globe. While they might be remembered for the trenches in France, the Normandy landings and the battle for Iwo Jima, these wars spanned tens of countries and their effects endured long before their ending. Their beginnings are rooted in events that occurred years if not decades before the first shot was fired. These great wars are not isolated events, they’re the consequence of great powers struggling for world domination.

This game is about the men and women that participated in these events, about what motivated them, their past and their dreams, their actions and the burden of the consequences. It is about your character and the role taken during the events of the 20th century. Is your character a front line soldier? A spy? A poet or writer? A leader of masses? An economist? A scientist? On what side does your character stand and in what way does it seek to alter the course of history and destiny in favor of its great nation?

223203.name: Saints & Sinners Quick Start Guide
223203.description:
User summary:

This document provides the basic processes used in the game to create characters and resolve actions. Intended as a quick start guide, probably it functions better as a play reference.

223204.name: Saints & Sinners Character Sheet
223204.description:
User summary:

This document presents a two-page character sheet designed for the game. It is intended for print-and-play use.

223205.name: Paths of Power
223205.description:
From publisher blurb:

A field of magical energy envelops Urth and spreads out across the cosmos. A residual force left from the act of creation that brought this reality into being, this energy is the cause of nearly all the strangeness found in the world: from the bizarre monsters spawned within the foul slicks pooling in caves deep under Blötland to the hidden kingdoms of the faeries; it is responsible for the floating lands above the Desolation and countless other oddities one encounters when traveling the lands of Rûl and beyond.

This energy has even been harnessed and channeled into the creation of artifacts and relics of wondrous and terrible power. More common, however, than all of these supernatural phenomena and wonders are spells: magical effects discovered, codified, and devised by those people who make a study of magic in its many forms. From the destruction of the fireball spell to the awful glory of hateful defecation, spells offer staggering power to those individuals with the patience, cunning, and will to learn them.

The Paths of Shadows series expands and updates certain paths from Shadow of the Demon Lord to create new variations and possibilities. Paths of Power deals with the sorcerer, spellbinder, warlock, and wizard, and in most cases offers upgrades and enhancements to make them even more exciting to play. In addition, this supplement introduces a new path: the occultist, a dreaded devotee of dark magic, who peers into places others fear to look.

223206.name: The Sundown Ablaze
223206.description:
From the introduction:

The Sundown hangs in a state of quarantine. From every corner of the Icharian fleet, the name of an ancient, indelible enemy passes between crewmen in nervous whispers.

223207.name: The Magnificent Shadow
223207.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Calve Fort is in danger. A band of armed thugs and bandits is coming to steal all that is inside and kill anyone who resists. The citizens will beg strangers for salvation – they have enough gold and goods to offer, and they cannot find anyone else to help.

223208.name: Peat's Bog (One Page)
223208.description:
From the introduction:

The [characters] find themselves in the small farming thorp of Jakeston Rest at a roadside inn. While eating a meal they are approached by some local farmers reporting a Lizard infestation and will ask the heroic [characters] if they can take a quick look.

User summary:

This condensed version of OP3: Peat's Bog was submitted to the one page dungeon contest 2016.

223209.name: The Cult of Sleep
223209.description:
From the introduction:

Mysterious disappearances follow the townsfolk of Saltfork. They struggle to rebuild their lives after the loss of more than half their town. Can your party solve the mystery of the vanishing victims before the town tears itself apart?

223210.name: North Star Games 2017 PAX Pack
223210.description: PAX East 2017 promo questions for Wits & Wagers

223211.name: Descendants!
223211.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure involves a huge vertical cave some 5 miles deep into the earth. The players fall through a sinkhole inside a standing stone circle and plummet like rocks!

223212.name: 74,54 m2
223212.description:
From the introduction:

To enter this dungeon you need to open a heavy wooden door guarded with two locks and a chain, either forcefully or using your mad lock-picking skills. There are a lot of shoes on the floor. Don’t trip. Coats and bags hang on the walls. It’s a mess. You see a vacuum cleaner and a washing machine.

223213.name: Crypt of Nothern Prince
223213.description:
From the introduction:

A hundred years ago there lived and then dead a son of northern Prince Lyubim. With cut throat he and his young wife were found in his mansion-in-law’s apartment, the headman of the village Utyatya. Lyubim’s father Nemil ordered to dig a tomb. All the men of the village he gathered to build it. Then, Utyatya was burned by him, he came down to the crypt, so then nobody saw him. Do you want me to tell you about the crypt in the middle of conflagration that is not grown to this day? Well, pay and listen...

223214.name: The Weathered Pirate: "It's Treasure Ye Want?"
223214.description:
From the introduction:

Among the Fractured Isles, past pirates and harpies, merfolk and sundry beasts...

...is a peninsula with a narrow neck of land.

223215.description:
"It was an ambush. That’s the only way to describe it. The mother ship appeared out of nowhere, creating a massive shadow over the city. Within seconds, wave after wave of fighters poured out of it, filling the sky."

"We're launching the ships we have ready, but they aren't much. Our pilots must fight bravely to defend the planet while we ready the rest of the fleet. Explosions fill the sky, and we've taken some hits, but we won't give up. Will you?"

Flip Ships is a cooperative dexterity game in which players take on the roles of brave pilots defending their planet from an onslaught of firepower. Flip your ships to take out the encroaching enemies and to take down the powerful mother ship before it's too late.
223215.name: Flip Ships
boardgamepodcastepisode: #42: A Trip to Asheville, Herbaceous on Tap, Well Played games cafe, Dream Home, OutLawed, Heroes & Tricks and lots more
30. Devon Dice podcast: Not Too Busy To Play Games

223216.name: Prayers of Intersession
223216.description:
From the introduction:

A trickster has secretly been corrupting the prayers of a new priestess of benign deity to help her small village by answering them literally, sowing chaos; the arrival of adventurers is but the latest granted wish, and their decisions and actions will determine the fate of its unlucky inhabitants.

223217.name: Prisoners of the Gelatinous Dome!
223217.description:
From the introduction:

Trigonon the Unhinged Science Sorcerer fancied himself a chemist. He has paid the price for his curiosity, and so will you in... Prisoners of the Gelatinous Dome!

223218.name: A Wild Chase
223218.description:
From the introduction:

You are being chased across a cold icy open plain by five giants. A sheer impenetrable cliff face rises before you. Dexter, your guide says, “The secret door is right up there in the cliff face. Somewhere. Find the door and then I will give you the spell to open it.”

223219.name: Good Little Trains
223219.description:
In Good Little Trains, players become train drivers eager to delivery their cargo to the ring of colourful stations connected by an ever-changing layout of tracks.

Every turn you have a chance to switch one piece of track before both your own train and the neutral 'Ghost' train both head out across the network of rail lines. Aim to drop your own cargo at the most valuable stations, while also having an eye on where the Ghost train is headed, and what your competitors are up to!

If at the end of a turn all the stations of one colour have cargo, then those stations are scored. All players can earn points for their cargo, and the player who triggered the scoring gets a coin. Once all 10 coins have been taken, the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

Good Little Trains is the first product of a new collaboration between the co-designers of 'Elysium', 'Costa Rica, 'Pyramids and 'Professor Evil and the Citadel of Time'. All these new games will be available as free print-and-play downloads from the Good Little Games website, alongside the existing catalogue of free microgames including the original editions of Pocket Imperium, Empire Engine and Bad Grandmas.

223220.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 241 - 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
223220.description:
"Hack at Dawn"
Cover by The Fraim Brothers

223222.name: Midnight Taboo
223222.description:
Description from the publisher:

Adults Only Version of Taboo

Experience unspeakable late night fun with the Midnight Taboo game, the adult-rated edition of the popular game of forbidden words. Get your team to guess the target word on the card, but you can't use any of the forbidden words in your clues, or your opponents will buzz the buzzer and you'll lose your turn. Be prepared for hilarious moments as you race against the clock to give your team the best descriptions and clues possible. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins the glory!

223223.name: Midnight Outburst
223223.description:
Description from the publisher:

Adults Only Outburst!

Midnight Outburst is the shout-out Party Game of inappropriate Top 10 lists—a wild, raunchy and definitely “adults only” version of the classic game. So you can forget about all that stuff you learned in school—with Midnight Outburst, you and your friends will show off your knowledge of what’s really important in life—like drinking games, bodily functions, recreational drugs, genital slang, music and more.

It’s easy to play— which is good, because you’re probably drunk. Just pick a card and choose a topic. Then, everyone on your team shouts out as many answers as they can in 45 seconds. The more you match, the more your team scores. And the more you’ll impress your friends with your amazing repertoire of all things naughty.

Midnight Outburst. Great for game nights, parties, or for turning an otherwise boring night into a party.

223224.name: The Baron Rises
223224.description:
From the introduction:

Legend says that “On the 13th day of the 13th year when darkness swallows the full moon Baron Vandilcroft will rise from his crypt to once again rule over the people of Riven.”. That night has come and only you can stand against the Baron and break the curse that haunts the people of Riven.

223225.name: The Midden of the Mewler
223225.description:
From the introduction:

A crevasse or sinkhole somewhere above serves as a sewer/dumping ground for that level's inhabitants.

223226.name: Death of the Sinner
223226.description:
From the introduction:

The Vantærum Academy was created for the training of Holy Warriors. The Dean, Arbatarius Vantærum, labored to magically amplify an artifact called The Orb of Judgement in an attempt to banish all traces of evil from the land. Instead he unleashed the power of Unholy Judgment which devastated the Academy. The land around the Academy, once fertile, is now blasted and forlorn, with tormented undead roaming ceaselessly. Mostly in ruins with its three top stories shattered and collapsing, the only discernible entrance to the Academy leads down into the subterranean Temple area.

223227.name: Orient Express
223227.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 1912. Europe is boiling with the imminent war. And the Orient Express is full of spies, diplomats, royalty, nobles, business entrepreneurs and intrigue. The Orient Express has acquired a well-deserved reputation of comfort and luxury, the cuisine is also quite famous.

223228.name: Ivanhoe
223228.description:
One side of the board has a simple roll and run game. The first player to reach space 120 wins th game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game on the other side of the board can be discribed as "roll, run and collect". On some spaces the players can collect small cards, worth different amounts of points. If a figure gets on an occupied space it robs the cards the other figure is "carying". Cards may be brought to safety by using the shortcuts into the caste along the way.

The game ends when all players are back in the castle, but only if one player has found the card with Ivanhoe's coat of arms. If not, the players have to continue the game till one finds this card and thereby ends the game. The player with the most points wins the game.

223229.name: Karma Zootra
223229.description:
From the introduction:

Somebody has mysteriously purchased the abandoned jail just outside of town, there's been construction day and night for weeks, What could possibly be happening there!

223230.name: The Stones, the Ship, and the Fortress
223230.description:
From the introduction:

The evil sorcerer Sacrebleu is terrorizing the land with his flying fortress. The fortress moves daily. A giant thundercloud underneath the fortress puts everything in danger of getting hit by lightning.

223231.name: The Black Tower
223231.description:
From the introduction:

In the middle of the desolate plain, in the ruins of an ancient settlement a huge black stone tower stands as the starless night, no windows is seen in its facade, and only one large double doors of ebony and black metal protruding from the facade.
